comments:
Steps:
1.I created a new plugin in the existing library - no errors.
2.Then I created a new configuration,there is prompt for entering name. I entered name and clicked ok. There is error which says to check the log.
3.Following is part of log:
java.lang.NullPointerException
	at org.eclipse.epf.authoring.ui.forms.ConfigurationPage$ConfigPackageLabelProvider.getText(ConfigurationPage.java:1203)
After reloading the library, I can see the new configuration but when I click on the tab 'plugin and package selection', there is error dlg and can't get rid of it. I have to kill the application.
Ultra Edit is adding extra/illegal characters and hence there is exception.

We couldn't load the process for certain packages. These packages probably been edited by UltraEdit which added certain chars in the beginning of those XMI files. Sun JRE parser couldn't load those XMI files but IBM JRE could. Phong has to deliver this fix in persistence code to strip-off those characters.

Fixed NullPointerException in UI by showing processComponent name (most likely it will show as blank) if process is not loaded correctly.
Works fine now. Verified in build M3-N20060530
